└┴┘└─┘┴─┘└─┘└─┘┴ ┴└─┘   ┴ └─┘  └─┘└─┘┴└─┴┴   ┴ ┴└─ o ┴└─┘   ┴ └─┘┴└─┴ ┴┴┘└┘┴ ┴┴─┘

The terminal is a scriptr.io debugging tool that provides a rich set of commands for invoking endpoints using different protocols and options.

It can be used with multiple scriptr.io accounts by changing the token using the set command. By default, it is set to the hosting account's token.

Type help to find available options.

Use "help [command name]" to display specific info about a command. Available commands are:

{{ commands }}

If a command is not recognized, the terminal will assume it's a <script name> and will HTTP POST <script name> to scriptr.io. The syntax of a POST command is assumed for the remaining arguments.

Duh!
Invokes a scriptr.io endpoint by using a WebSocket connection.

Parameters:
 <endpoint>:	endpoint URL
 -d <JSON>:	request parameters
 --no-log:	don't show logs
 --no-response:	don't show response

Example:
ws my/script -d {"humidity": "33", "temp": "22"} --no-response --no-log
Invokes a scriptr.io endpoint by using HTTP {{ method }}.

Parameters:
 <endpoint>:	endpoint URL
 -d <JSON>:	request parameters
 -H <JSON>:	request headers
 --no-log:	don't show logs
 --no-response:	don't show response

Example:
{{ method }} my/script -d {"humidity": "33", "temp": "22"} -H {"header1":"value1"} --no-response --no-log
Lists scripts available on the account.
Maps the parameters of any command to simplify invoking scripts from command line without having to create a JSON.

Parameters:
 <command>:	command name
 <parameters>:	command parameters
 --no-log:	don't show logs
 --no-response:	don't show response


Example:
mapCommand my/script humidity temp --no-response --no-log

Now when you call the script called "my/script", instead of passing its parameters "humidity" and "temp" in a JSON object, you can simply call it as follows:
my/script "33" "22"
Sets the token to be used by the terminal to invoke scriptr.io scripts.


Usage:
set token=<value>
Invokes an MQTT endpoint.
Shows history of typed commands.
  -clear: deletes history
{{ timestamp }} {{ level }} {{ message }}
